page.title: 20RELIGION IN OLDBURY
page.content: The first known place of worship in Oldbury was a chapel-of-ease, built in 1529. Oldbury was a stronghold of early non-conformity and it still has a rich variety of styles of worship. The parish church of Christ Church was built in 1841. It recently faced a decline in attendance and was threatened with closure but a revival of interest has taken place. There is a R.C. church, St. Francis Xavier, built in 1965, but the non-conformist tendency is still in evidence for the pentecostal churches of the Bethel Temple and the New Testament Church of God are still very well attended. In the area there is also a Temple of Light, a Zion Methodist Church and a House Mosque for Muslims.
